title: Tangshan and Xuzhou: Fury and questions over China's treatment of women
description: Two prominent cases of abuse have ignited a debate about misogyny among the country's young women.

title: Katie Price: The rise and fall of a glamour model
description: The 44-year-old is due to be sentenced on Friday, after admitting breaching a restraining order.

title: The small seaport crucial for Europe's energy future
description: As neighbour Germany takes a step closer to gas rationing a Polish seaside resort prepares to help.

title: Tower block safety: Disabled man carried to flat after lifts broke down
description: Adam Gabsi had to be carried up six floors to his flat after the lifts in his tower block broke down.

title: World's lowest parachute jump attempt
description: Former paratrooper, John Bream, jumped from 85 ft (26m) in order to claim the title.

title: Train strikes: Why haven't they caused more disruption?
description: The post-pandemic shift to working from home means disruption caused by the strikes has been more limited.

title: Anita Alvarez: Coach saves US swimmer who fainted during competition
description: Artistic swimmer Anita Alvarez was rescued from the bottom of the pool at the world championships.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Survivors struggle for food and shelter amidst cholera fears
description: Secunder Kermani reports from Paktika, Afghanistan, where one survivor says he lost 20 relatives.

title: Paul McCartney's Glastonbury warm-up gig instant sell-out
description: Tickets to see the former Beatle at the Cheese and Grain in Frome on Friday sold out within minutes.

title: Ukraine war round-up: A harrowing trial and EU breakthrough
description: A Russian soldier is tried in his absence for rape and Ukraine moves closer to EU membership.

title: Florida nabs largest python ever found in state
description: The female python was nearly 18ft long (5m) - and was pregnant with an astonishing 122 eggs.

title: El Sistema: How a Venezuelan music scheme changed Raploch
description: Did music really change lives on one of Scotland's most deprived estates?

title: Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's first official portrait released
description: The artist says he wanted to portray the couple as elegant and relaxed in the painting, now on public display.

title: 'Remarkable!' - watch Nicholls' bizarre Test dismissal
description: Watch the moment New Zealand's Henry Nicholls is bizarrely dismissed after his shot deflects off team-mate Daryl Mitchell's bat and into the hands of Alex Lees on the first day of the third Test at Headingley.

title: Quiz of the week: What's the biggest freshwater fish?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: Afghanistan quake: Gyan clinic with five beds for 500 injured patients
description: A worker at the only health clinic in Gyan in Paktika province, tells the BBC how they were overwhelmed.

title: Polio: What is it and how does it spread?
description: What is polio and how can you protect yourself from it?

title: Germany takes step closer to gas rationing
description: The country triggers the "alarm" stage of its emergency gas plan after a drop in Russian supplies.

title: England v New Zealand: Jack Leach traps Will Young lbw with his first ball
description: Jack Leach traps Will Young lbw with his first ball in the third Test of England's series against New Zealand at Headingley.

title: Met Police to be re-investigated over serial killer Port
description: Victims' families say police "have blood on their hands" over the handling of Stephen Port's killings.

title: Stockport police inspector pauses council meeting to chase shoplifter
description: When a suspected thief ran past a council meeting, a police inspector set off in hot pursuit.

title: Glastonbury Festival: Rail strike fails to halt many music fans
description: With half the rail network closed, travellers from Paddington Station were pleasantly surprised.

title: Time Out publishes final print edition after 54 years
description: The listings magazine was first launched as a newsletter by Tony Elliott on the King's Road in 1968.

title: Afghanistan quake: Many children killed in disaster, doctors say
description: Over 1,000 people died in the disaster, with many children killed after being trapped in buildings.

title: Oxford LTNs: Crews chop damaged bollard to get fire engine through
description: Firefighters were unable to take the bollard out using a key because it had previously been damaged.

title: More rail strikes extremely likely, says union boss
description: Travellers are facing another day of disruption on the second day of strikes, as half the network closes.

title: Two charged with child organ-harvesting conspiracy
description: An investigation was launched after detectives were alerted to potential modern slavery offences.

title: England v New Zealand: Stuart Broad removes Tom Latham for a duck
description: Joe Root catches Tom Latham off Stuart Broad for a duck to give England an early breakthrough on the first day of the third Test against New Zealand.

title: Just 100 days left to spend paper £20 and £50 notes
description: It will soon be impossible to pay in shops with the notes, which are being replaced by plastic versions.

title: Rail strike: Short queues at Paddington for Glastonbury trains
description: Early birds heading to Glastonbury are surprised to find quiet queues at London Paddington station.

title: Eastbourne: Serena Williams & Ons Jabeur withdraw from doubles
description: Serena Williams and Ons Jabeur withdraw from the Eastbourne doubles because of a right knee injury to the Tunisian.

title: Islanders save lost luggage couple's wedding
description: An American couple's luggage - including the bride's dress - disappeared en-route to Scotland.

title: Court says widower can use embryo made with late wife
description: Court backs Ted Jennings to try for a baby with a surrogate, using embryo he created with late wife.

title: Eating disorder survivor finds menu calories triggering
description: The Welsh government is deciding whether to introduce a similar rule to the one in England.

title: Raheem Bailey: 'Racism and constant abuse' of boy who lost finger
description: Raheem Bailey's mother says it is "painful" he had to prepare himself mentally to go into school.

title: Vincent Chin: The murder that sparked a civil rights movement
description: 'Vincent Chin would be alive today if he were not Asian'.

title: Martin Lewis says he was rejected by House of Lords
description: The consumer champion applied for a peerage but says he couldn't commit enough time to politics.

title: Stuart Broad and Mollie King announce pregnancy
description: The England star and BBC Radio 1 broadcaster shared their news on Instagram.

title: Rail strikes: The passengers who fear they will miss life events
description: The BBC hears from people set to miss holidays and stag dos, as rail strikes take place.

title: Ukraine war: Russia aiming to 'destroy' Donbas, Zelensky says
description: An advisor to Mr Zelensky says the battle for two key Donbas cities has reached a 'fearsome climax'.

title: Wimbledon: Serena Williams plays but Roger Federer absent as GOAT race nears end
description: With injury concerns over many of tennis' big names going in to Wimbledon, are the young players ready to make a major breakthrough?

title: World Aquatics Championships: US artistic swimmer Anita Alvarez rescued by coach after fainting in pool
description: American artistic swimmer Anita Alvarez is rescued from the bottom of the pool by her coach after fainting at the World Aquatics Championships.

title: Newspaper headlines: Polio alert and Sunak defends pension rise
description: The papers lead with the discovery of polio in the UK and the chancellor defending pension rises.

title: National Gallery: Famous artworks go on loan for first time
description: For its 200th anniversary, masterpieces by Constable and Monet will be exhibited across the UK.

title: Vaccine Damage Payment Scheme: The battle for compensation
description: More than 1,300 claims have been made but only about 20 sent for medical assessment.
